articles.title: Preserving the Majestic Hundred Islands
articles.description: A community-led initiative to protect Alaminos' natural treasure.
articles.cotent: The Hundred Islands National Park remains a cornerstone of Pangasinan heritage. Local government units are implementing stricter waste management to ensure the islands remain pristine for the next generation. Tourists are encouraged to participate in 'eco-tours' that educate on marine biodiversity.

articles.title: The Secrets of Cape Bolinao Lighthouse
articles.description: Tracing the history of the second tallest lighthouse in the Philippines.
articles.cotent: Built in 1905, the Cape Bolinao Lighthouse has guided mariners for over a century. Historians are currently digitizing original architectural plans to aid in a new restoration project aimed at preserving its Spanish-era masonry and ironwork.

articles.title: Restoring the Manaoag Basilica Ruins
articles.description: Archeologists find new artifacts near the historic religious site.
articles.cotent: Recent excavations near the Minor Basilica of Our Lady of the Rosary of Manaoag have unearthed 18th-century pottery. These finds offer a glimpse into the daily lives of early Pangasinan settlers and their religious devotions.

articles.title: Traditional Salt Making in Dasol
articles.description: The 'Asin' industry fights to keep ancient methods alive.
articles.cotent: Dasol salt farmers are teaching youth the traditional 'Purok' method of salt harvesting. This heritage trade is vital not just for the economy, but for maintaining the unique culinary identity of the province.

articles.title: Healing Waters of Balungao Hot Springs
articles.description: Exploring the geothermal heritage of Eastern Pangasinan.
articles.cotent: Balungao is becoming a hub for health tourism. The local heritage office is documenting the folk stories associated with the springs, which many elders believe possess spiritual healing properties.

articles.title: The Art of Bagoong Making in Lingayen
articles.description: A deep dive into the fermentation process that defined a region.
articles.cotent: Lingayen's bagoong is more than a condiment; it's a science inherited from ancestors. Modern factories are now opening their doors for heritage tours to show how clay vats are still used today.

articles.title: Our Mother Language: Preserving Pangasinense
articles.description: New schools adopt heritage language programs.
articles.cotent: With the rise of global languages, educators in Dagupan are launching 'Pangasinense Nights' to encourage the youth to speak, write, and perform poetry in their native tongue.

articles.title: The Ancient Crafts of San Carlos
articles.description: Bamboo weaving techniques survive the digital age.
articles.cotent: San Carlos weavers are innovating by combining traditional bamboo patterns with modern fashion. These products are now reaching international markets, showcasing Pangasinan craftsmanship.

articles.title: Pistay Dayat: A Celebration of the Sea
articles.description: Preparing for the biggest heritage festival of the year.
articles.cotent: Pistay Dayat 2026 promises to be the largest yet. Events include boat racing, sand castle building, and a massive street dance competition that tells the story of the sea's bounty.

articles.title: Virtual Reality Heritage Tours Launched
articles.description: Next.js 14 project brings history to mobile phones.
articles.cotent: The Pangasinan Heritage Digital Showcase is now live. Using cutting-edge web tech, users can take 360-degree tours of heritage sites from anywhere in the world, ensuring accessibility for all.

spots.title: Bolinao Lighthouse

spots.title: Balungao Hot Spring
spots.description: Experience therapeutic warmth at the foot of Mt. Balungao, perfect for relaxation and eco-tourism.
